isis.stitle: TSI 97-12-06 - Performance Specifications for 1997 Model Year T 444E Engine Applications

subjectgroup.subject: Performance Specifications for 1997 Model Year T 444E Engine Applications

geninfo.para: Engine Performance Specifications are being released to service for the T 444E engine applications listed below. (For 1994 - 1996 Model Years T 444E Engines, refer to TSI 96-12-19.)

note.para: Refer to the emission label on the engine to correctly identify the Engine Model Year and Horsepower Rating (indicated by punched hole).

para.emph: Engine Model
Engine Rating
Engine Family Rating Code
Engine Unit Code - 49 State
Engine Unit Code - Calif.
Table Index

svcproc.title: T 444E/175 HP @ 2300 RPM (50 State 1997 Model Year)

table.title: T 444E/175 HP @ 2300 RPM (50 State 1997 Model Year)

para.emph: T 444E/175 HP @ 2300 RPM (50 State 1997 Model Year) [Engine Unit Code 12NHW, 49 State] [Engine Unit Code 12NHZ, Calif.] Performance Specifications

entry.para: Turbocharger Part Number (With Exhaust Back Pressure Device)
Turbocharger Part Number (Without Exhaust Back Pressure Device)
High Idle Speed - RPM with Manual Transmission
High Idle Speed - RPM with Automatic Transmission
Injection Control Pressure/ Voltage @ Low Idle No Load
Injection Control Pressure/ Voltage @ High Idle No Load
Injection Control Pressure/ Voltage @ Rated Speed and Full Load
Intake and Exhaust Valve Clearance (Engine Off - Hot or Cold): Intake
Intake and Exhaust Valve Clearance (Engine Off - Hot or Cold): Exhaust

para.emph: The following data to be taken at high idle with [no load].

entry.para: Air Cleaner Restriction* (Measured @ Air Cleaner Outlet) (Check at High Idle No Load) - Max
Air Cleaner Restriction* (Measured @ Air Cleaner Outlet) (Check at Full Load, Rated Speed) - Max

para.emph: The following data to be taken at full load, full throttle rated engine speed on chassis dynamometer or on highway.
Measure water temperature differential across the radiator with engine on a chassis dynamometer, at full load and ambient temperature of 80°F or above.
The following data to be taken after engine reaches stabilized operating temperature.

entry.para: Lube Oil Pressure at Operating Temperature - Low Idle (Min.)
Lube Oil Pressure at Operating Temperature - Rated Speed(Min./Max.)
*Engine must be at normal operating temperature.
**Crankcase pressure [maximum] as measured with Orificed Restrictor Tool ZTSE4146.
